Letter to Louis L. McInnis from M. Sevictez (), March 5, 1887
Box 1 Louis L. McInnis Papers/Box 1 Folder 24 Louis L. McInnis Papers

en: Letter from M. A. Withers to Professor Louis L. McInnis regarding his son Allie's illness and request to return home from college. Withers indicates he will permit his son to leave school only if the attending physician and McInnis determine it is necessary for his health recovery. The correspondence reflects 19th-century family and educational practices regarding student welfare.

body.value:
John G. Blanks,
N. Y. Office,
51 Leonard Street.

Office of

Jas. G. Blanks.

BLANKS, SON & CO.
DEALERS IN
DRY GOODS, GROCERIES & GENERAL MERCHANDISE.

LOCKHART, TEXAS, March 5 1887.

Profesor L. L. McInnis
Collage

Dear Sir

Allie writes me that he is Sick
and wants to come home for a
while. I have written him that
if his Dr Sayes he is not able
to attend School for some time
then he might come home for a
while. but I dont want him to
come if he is able to Stay. If
you think best for him to come
let him come. I will depend on
you to act in this matter for me
Kind regards to your Wife

Yours truly
M A Withers
